snippet: The JOBS Act is a bad law, but at least the S.E.C. has resisted pressure to rush through new rules without seeking public comment.
abstract: Editorial praises Securities and Exchange Commission chairwoman Mary Schapiro for resisting Congressional pressure to rush passage of the JOBS Act--Jump-Start Our Business Start-Ups--law that would end longstanding investor protections, reduce market transparency and lower accounting and auditing standards for companies planning to go public; contends that the law would be a boon to hedge funds while endangering common investors.
lead_paragraph: The JOBS Act is a bad law, but at least the S.E.C. has resisted pressure to rush through new rules without seeking public comment.
